OCD.name: Logical Operators for Wires
OCD.description: A component that applies a logical operator to one or two boolean properties received from the first and, optionally, the second input port, emitting the result. For binary operators, the operation is performed when a new envelope is received on a port, using the envelope cached by the other port; alternatively, new envelopes must be received on both ports. For the NOT operator, the operand must be received from the first port.

AD.name: Operator
AD.description: Specifies the logical operation to be executed by the component

AD.name: First Operand
AD.description: Specifies the name of the operand property in the envelope received on the first port.

AD.name: Second Operand
AD.description: Specifies the name of the operand property in the envelope received on the second port; ignored by the NOT operator.

AD.name: Result Name
AD.description: Specifies the name of the result property in the emitted envelope.

AD.name: Barrier
AD.description: Specifies if the component should use a barrier for input ports or perform caching of messages; ignored by the NOT operator
